author: Szu Ping Chan
title: Steven Mnuchin: the man who went from Goldman Sachs to US Treasury Secretary via Magic Mike XXL
text:
Steven Mnuchin: the man who went from Goldman Sachs to US Treasury Secretary via Magic Mike XXL Steven Mnuchin followed his father into banking and worked for Goldman Sachs for 17 years Credit: AFP Szu Ping Chan  07am 
A mericans who want to catch a glimpse of the new US Treasury Secretary need look no further than their local cinema or television set. 
Steven Mnuchin [pronounced mi-new-chin], who was confirmed by the Senate on Monday by a mostly party-line vote of 53-47, made his debut on the silver screen in November in Rules Don’t Apply. 
The synopsis of the film, which sees an aspiring actress and an ambitious businessman's lives changed in "unpredictable and incredible ways" has some parallels with Donald Trump's own journey to the White House . 
Mr Mnuchin the "actor" has a cameo role as a Merrill Lynch banker, but the 53-year-old is no stranger to Wall Street. 
Following in the footsteps of his father Robert, he become a banker at Goldman Sachs in 1985 after studying at Yale. NEW: Senate confirms nomination of Steven Mnuchin to be treasury secretary, 53 yeas to 47 nays https://t.co/Okz2bwUl4f pic.twitter.com/UQsvFb5F52 — CBS News (@CBSNews) February 14, 2017 
H e worked there for 17 years, including working with mortgage backed securities in the mid-1990s, where he rose to the role of vice chairman of the division. 
Mr Mnuchin also worked with the man who broke the Bank of England . 
Billionaire George Soros hired him in 2003 to start a new business focused on buying risky debt. 
SFM Capital Management, Mr Soros's business, was seen by many as Mr Mnuchin's move from banking to the hedge fund industry. 
But Mr Mnuchin wouldn't have been Mr Trump's preferred candidate if he didn't bring with him at least a bit of glamour. 
In 2004, backed by Mr Soros, Mr Mnuchin founded Dune Capital Management with two former Goldman colleagues. 
The company quickly expanded into the entertainment business, partnering with 21st Century Fox to back Avatar, one of the highest grossing films in history. Bradley Cooper stars in the Mnuchin-backed film, American Sniper Credit: AP 
M r Mnuchin now counts Suicide Squad, American Sniper and even Magic Mike XXL among his producer credits after forming RatPac Entertainment, which merged with Dune a few years ago to become RatPac-Dune Entertainment. 
Also rather like Mr Trump - who has flirted with different political parties before settling with the Republicans - Mr Mnuchin and his family have aligned themselves more with the Democrats than Republicans in the past. 
He has donated to Hillary Clinton's past campaigns, according to electoral commission records, including the maximum $2,300 to her presidential primary bid in 2007. He later backed Barack Obama's bid. 
The Treasury Secretary has also donated to campaigns run by John Edwards, John Kerry and Al Gore, according to Dow Jones. 
Records show Mitt Romney is the only Republican presidential candidate Mr Mnuchin has ever donated to, although in an interview with Dow Jones, he said that "for as long as I can remember voting," he has been a registered Republican. 
"He has experience managing large and complicated private-sector enterprises and in negotiating difficult compromises and making tough decisions - and being accountable for those decisions," said Senator Orrin Hatch, chairman of the Finance Committee after he was confirmed. Mnuchin pictured with fiancee Louise Linton Credit: Rex 
M r Trump appointed Mr Mnuchin as his national finance chairman last year, where he helped to cultivate a network of small donors that helped the then presidential candidate compete with Mrs Clinton. 
Mr Mnuchin is following in the footsteps of fellow Goldman bankers Hank Paulson, who served under George W. Bush, and Robert Rubin, who served under Bill Clinton. 
But New York-born Mr Mnuchin has had to use all his Hollywood hardball negotiating skills to secure his role in the cabinet. 
His nomination was savaged by Democrats after it emerged he failed to declare more than $100 million of financial assets. 
He did not disclose $95 million worth of property - houses in New York City, the Hamptons, Los Angeles and Mexico. He also initially failed to disclose that he is the director of Dune Capital International, an investment fund incorporated in the Cayman Islands, along with management posts in seven other investment funds. Profile | Steve Mnuchin 
A nd he belatedly disclosed that his three children, from his second marriage to Heather Crosby, a corporate communications executive, own nearly $1 million in artwork. 
Asked about the omissions at his hearing, Mr Mnuchin described them as an oversight – a mistake amid mountains of paperwork. 
“I think as you all can appreciate, filling out these government forms is quite complicated,” he said, noting he had handed over 5,000 pages of disclosures. “Let me first say, any oversight, it was unintentional.” 
It poured fuel on the fires of his critics, who also brought up an unfortunate nickname earned while working in property deals: “Foreclosure King”. Americans who claim they were forced out of their homes as a result of Mr Mnuchin’s mortgage dealings demanded to be heard at his hearing; 23 senate Democrats wrote to demand outside witnesses at the hearing, saying Mr Mnuchin's bank, OneWest, carried out 36,000 foreclosures forcing people from their homes. 
Among those upon whom OneWest foreclosed were an elderly California couple tossed from their home of 50 years despite qualifying for a government-assisted loan modification, and a 90-year-old Florida woman who had a payment error that led to a 27-cent shortfall on her mortgage, the letter said. 
Mr Mnuchin and his team sold OneWest in 2015, reaping around $1.5 billion in profits, the letter said. “His bank’s treatment of families seeking to avoid foreclosure is critical to assessing his fitness to serve as the nation’s top economic policy official,” they wrote. Steven Mnuchin waits to testify before a Senate Finance Committee confirmation hearing Credit: Reuters 
T he outside witnesses were ultimately not allowed. 
The Treasury Secretary, who will play a key role in Trump’s tax cutting plans, has called for the largest tax overhaul since Reaganomics . 
“We think by cutting corporate taxes we’ll create huge economic growth and we’ll have huge personal income,” he told CNBC in November. 
He said cutting corporation tax to 15pc, from 30pc was a major goal for the Trump administration, as he called for the tax system to be simplified. 
“Taxes are way too complicated and people spend way too much time worrying about ways to get them lower,” he said. 
Mr Trump has described him as “a professional at the highest level with an extensive and very successful financial background”. 
Mr Mnuchin is engaged to Scottish actress Louise Linton, who recently came under fire for her memoir about living in Africa.
